alert.note: Alert for Knox; Morrow; Richland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 1:03PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Richland, northeastern Morrow and northwestern Knox Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 102 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mount Gilead, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Gilead, Lexington, Fredericktown, Cardington, Chesterville, Waterford, Edison, Fulton and Shauck. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
